review_content: Can 355ml (in Jeju). Golden colour, vanishing head. Sweer malty, grainy, plasticky aroma. Light-bodied. Flavour is similar... sweet malty, plasticky, fizzy. Industrial.

Can. Light golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty - some corn and lightly sweetish aroma, faint cardboard and metal. Body is light, malty - light corn and lightly sweetish flavor, light cardboard and faint hoppyness, faint metal. Finish is short, light cardboard and faint hoppyness, light metal. Watery lager with notes of metal.Tastes really cheap.
Bottle. Clear golden color with small white head. Aroma - Bread, malt, metal. Taste - Sweet, grass, grain, bread, malt.
Can in Seoul. Smooth neutral beginning. Moderate dry neutral with bitter hints. Dusty grainy with a neutral light bitterness.
There isn’t much I can say about this. Once you get that whiff of decaying food in an old fridge, you can get the level of beer you will be drinking.

35 cl can from a store in Gangnam, Seoul. Clear, light yellow color quickly dissipating bubbly white head. Wet papers and syrupy grains, unmalted stuff and booze. I wonder what dry yeast is. Thin body, the finish is indeed quite dry and a bit refreshing, but this is quite crappy, very bad.

Bottle 0.5 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.

Jasnozłote, mocno nasycone piwo o puszystej lecz nietrwałej pianie oraz słodowym z chmielowymi akcentami aromatem. W smaku orzeźwiające, lekko wodniste, słodowe z wytrawną, minimalnie metaliczną goryczką na finiszu.

330 ml can bought at magstore in Nathan Road, Jordan. 



Clear light golden yellow colour One-quarter finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Good sticky lacing and active small carbonation; Slightly pungent aroma of malt, with very light band-aid, light floral, sugar, yeast, lemon and very light grass; Close to medium sweet taste of malt, with rice, strong sugar, light floral, odd-tasting chemical, cracker, yeast, light lemon, very light bitter hops and faint grass; Light body. Slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is fairly dry. Maltyness is thinned by strong rice, but it was that enduring, band aid-like taste that’s really annoying, in addition the sugar is not that strong to the tongue but it’s teeth-roting. No good!... Hoppiness is light floral, lemon and thin grass in nose and taste. Bitterness is light, odd-tasting and extract-like for a lasting, light astringent sweet-bitter finish; Fairly dry after taste. Awkward and fairly bitter to mouth.



Comments: Usually this company makes some fairly good and drinkable lagers, but this is an exception - a mix of band-aid, odd chemicals and sugar ends this dry attempt into disaster. Drain pours!
Klares goldgelb mit wenig Schaum. Leicht würzig, leicht bitterer Nachgeschmack, etwas dünn.
330ml bottle poured pale gold with a decent fluffy head & a mild grainy aroma the taste is crisp watery slightly bitter & sort of dry
Bottle from friend, gold pour, white head, nose is lacking, taste is refreshing, smooth, water

Big bottle from H-Mart. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A big corn and grainy nose. Not great: skunky, bitter light fruit, round grainy sweetness dominates. Husky, corn and rice perhaps. All adjuncts. Overall, drinkable but barely. The skunkiness is terrible.

hay, cereal, nuts, toast, 
litely Hops spruce, herbs, 
dough, barnyard, leather, earthy, leaves, Yeast yet taste can be
banana, clove, cooked vegetables, skunky, 
pale, clear, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, slick feel, lively, soft carbonation,
Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is corn, brewing cereal and water. Taste is watery corn. You’re drinking a pale lager, oh you were expecting flavour? Hahaha silly you!
Bottle. Golden, clear, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, fizzy, & astringent finish.
Can 355ml (in Jeju). Golden colour, vanishing head. Sweer malty, grainy, plasticky aroma. Light-bodied. Flavour is similar... sweet malty, plasticky, fizzy. Industrial.

Can. Light golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty - some corn and lightly sweetish aroma, faint cardboard and metal. Body is light, malty - light corn and lightly sweetish flavor, light cardboard and faint hoppyness, faint metal. Finish is short,…
Bottle. Clear golden color with small white head. Aroma - Bread, malt, metal. Taste - Sweet, grass, grain, bread, malt.
Can in Seoul. Smooth neutral beginning. Moderate dry neutral with bitter hints. Dusty grainy with a neutral light bitterness.
There isn’t much I can say about this. Once you get that whiff of decaying food in an old fridge, you can get the level of beer you will be drinking.

35 cl can from a store in Gangnam, Seoul. Clear, light yellow color quickly dissipating bubbly white head. Wet papers and syrupy grains, unmalted stuff and booze. I wonder what dry yeast is. Thin body, the finish is indeed quite dry and a bit refreshing, but this…
Bottle 0.5 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.…
330 ml can bought at magstore in Nathan Road, Jordan.…
Klares goldgelb mit wenig Schaum. Leicht würzig, leicht bitterer Nachgeschmack, etwas dünn.
330ml bottle poured pale gold with a decent fluffy head & a mild grainy aroma the taste is crisp watery slightly bitter & sort of dry
Bottle from friend, gold pour, white head, nose is lacking, taste is refreshing, smooth, water

Big bottle from H-Mart. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A big corn and grainy nose. Not great: skunky, bitter light fruit, round grainy sweetness dominates. Husky, corn and rice perhaps. All adjuncts. Overall, drinkable but barely.…
hay, cereal, nuts, toast, litely Hops spruce, herbs,…
Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is corn, brewing cereal and water. Taste is watery corn. You’re drinking a pale lager, oh you were expecting flavour? Hahaha silly you!
Bottle. Golden, clear, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, fizzy, & astringent finish.

Ah the ticks you’ll grind when in Cambodia. Light gold, head lasts a bit longer than I’m used to here. Nose has rice and cereal, grass. Flavour isn’t particularly dry, bready, I think I prefer the NE Asian lagers to the SE Asian ones.
pachnie jabolem - siarka, igristoj taki. jasnozłoty kolor z dość kiepską pianą. w smaku słodko, trochę jak gazowana woda spod kukurydzy.

Je à pale golden lager with a thin white head. In aroma, classic eurolager with crisp malt, mineral notes, light German hops, OK. In mouth, a light refreshing lager with faint malt, mineral notes, watery, but I’ve seen more boring. Bottle from Renaissance lounge, Seoul.
Goldgelb mit geringem Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig. Geschmack wässrig malzig. Kein besonderes Lager!
Bottle. Clear golden pour with a head that disappeared quickly. Fruit, corn and grain. Sparkling water with slight sweetness at the end. Really watery. But not offensive
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
330ml bottle from The Little Bottler. Standard pale lager with not much of anything going on. One of those beers that you know are going to be average but you try it anyway.

330ml bottle, barcode 8801119683342, labelled Dry finish d imported, no mention of the brewery Hite. The fine print however on the label says brewed and bottled by Hite Jinro Co Ltd, Seoul Korea. The back of the label has a health warning in poorly translated Swedish. Pours clear pale golden, with a medium white head that dissipated quickly, and left no lacing. A faint aroma of corn and grain. Taste is of corn and sweet wheat bread. The taste is indeed dry as the name implies, but also somewhat sweet. As the beer warms up the alcohol becomes prominent, and there is also a funky cabbage like character. Fizzy carbonation, light watery body and a thin texture. I acquired this beer just because I wanted to taste a beer from Korea. However doesn’t live up to my already low expectations on Korean beer. Everything about it is bizarre to me, even the name and strange futuristic design of the logo, the poorly translated Swedish text on the label, and the sweet but yet dry taste. And this is supposedly tastier than the ordinary Hite? With all that said, still quite okay to drink cold with spicy food.

Sample from bottle @SBWF13. Pale yellow with small white head. Aroma of corn and pale malt, some cardboard. Taste is corn, pale malt, watery and bland. The boot babes tried to convince us that "this has MUCH more flavor than the ordinary Hite"

Gdzie tu wytrawny finisz? Piwo na skruty. Dziwna etykieta, egzotyczny posmak, czyli glukoza i syropy z jeczmienia i wszechpanujaca kukurydza. Marka podstawowa prawie taka sama. Nie rozroznia sie smaku miedzy jednym jak i drugim. Wieksze tylko nagazowanie.
Can @ DØE meeting. Pours fizzy light yellow with a fading white head. Aroma of malt, grain, corn. Flavor is sweet, grainy and loads of corn. Thin watery body, lively carbonation. 280813
(bottle 28 /08-2013) very low white head, light yellow color, fucking close to water.
Can @ døe sommer fest. Pale yellow, small white head, no lacing. Aroma, malty, maize, banana, . Taste, malty, maize, banana, . I guess it’s a rating. A lot of carbonation.

Can. Not half as bad as the Hite beer I had at Incheon Airport a few years ago that still gives me nightmares. Wheaty, bready aromas. Not as much corn flavour as comparable Japanese macro lagers. Not exactly dry finishing- almost creamy if anything- but not a bad palate. Tolerable, which for the price of a happoshu, meant good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not excited for this, but here goes... smells like a cheap pale lager, though the nose is fairly light. Looks like a cheap pale lager. Taste is dry without the residual sweetness so often associated with pale lagers. Whatever. Completely forgettable.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle at Honey Pig Centreville.  It pours a slightly lighter gold than the Hite Max with a thin white head.  The nose doesn’t give you much, perhaps a touch of grain.  The flavor is on the weak side with a club soda, grain, and slight bitterness.  Smooth with a dry finish.
Even I said OB Golden Lager is best in all Korean Lagers, this Dry Finish D is easier to drink and goes down quickly.

Clear golden pour with high carbonation. Grainy flavor with a strong taste of corn. Smells like your standard Korean lager. Goes down easy...not sure what this dry brewing process is all about

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

smell is metallic, musty, corny. appearance is a medium gold with no head, taste is malty, a little sweet, slightly overcarbonated but it doesnt feel thin. not bad, its slightly harsher and more maltliquorishy than the 4.5% alc hite/cass/max so a good choice to slip in to mix it up if they’re your only choices

Bottle picked up in Korea Town (Los Angeles).  Pours to a golden body with a nice crisp white head.  Flavors and aroma of crisp rice and white bread.  Light saaz like hop.  Dry and very clean palate.  Surprisingly drinkable.

Purchased a bottle at the market in K-Town (Los Angeles). Pours a clear, light gold with a lacy white head. Smells very mild; like white bread. The taste is of wheat, some mild hops and a bit of lemon. The aftertaste is dry and lingering. I was not sure what to expect, but this beer was more drinkable and enjoyable than a Miller Lite, so there is that...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml Can from Supermarket in Mapo, Seoul. Clear golden blond coloured beer with some light carbonation and a rather small white head. Light grainy pilsener malty hinted aroma. Medium to full sweet hinted palate. Finish is bitter sweet with a longer sweet dry malty ending. Regular lager. Nothing special.

Clear golden straw color with a white head.  A strange white grape aroma, along with some apple.  There’s a fair bit of cereal and grain sweetness to it.  A hint of floral hops, and a light corn note.  The flavor is sweet up front, but does have a nice dry finish.  Crisp on the palate with light floral hop flavors, a touch of yeast, and some fruity esters.

(bottle) Clear pale gold with little head. Pleasant but subtle aroma. Light body, medium carbonation. Taste is not bad: rather light on flavour but nice balance between sweet and citrus tang; with a very little amount of bitterness. Overall, its OK.
It did not get flat even an hour after opening. The taste was very neat, dry, and well-kept until I finished the large bottle.
Bottle poured a clear gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of corn, bread and light straw. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread and light straw with a crisp finish.

Golden colour, small white head. Aroma of straw, hay, light hops, quite a bit perfume. Rather dry, malts, light sweet. Short, dry finish. Not bad, quite refreshing pilsener.
(From 0,5L can @ ZZT3, Oirschot. Courtesy of joes)
50cl can @ ZZT III. Courtesy of Joes. Clear golden color, no head. Smell malts, grains, lightly wort and rice. Taste malts, grains, rice. Dry finish. Low body, low carbo.
Can thx to joes @zzt3. Crisp, clear yellow colour with a head that dissapeares quickly. Smells malty and sharp. Tastes sharp, thin, pilsener, malts. Bit on the thin side palate-wise.
